reviews.review_msg: Lectures were interesting and he's overall a likeable, chill guy who has a lot of passion for what he teaches. He is interested in his students and gives great feedback and advice. Yes, there's a bit of writing, but barely as much as most comms courses.

Absolute gem of a professor, gives very detailed feedback while trying to fit into your perspective of the topic, even if he disagrees with your perspective. He's very well versed, passionate about the course and genuinely wants you to succeed.

Prof Martin is one of the best prof u will ever encouter in SFU. He understands his student's need and his lecture is very entertaining and never dull. I can listen to him talk all day and never get bored as he is very knowledgable in the field with many great stories about his life. Overall hundred percent recommand anyone to take his class.

There is no textbook, class recording, not even words on powerpoints, only pictures. Missing lectures will make tests difficult. He'll talk a lot if you ask him something, but be careful, not with a nice attitude every time

As others have said, after you have sat through a few classes, you realize that the lectures are all kinda the same and somehow they manage to all be about him.  Other profs in the department are better lecturers and are current and academically informed through writing papers, books and going to conferences.  All style, no substance, sigh.

I did not find the material very stimulating, but I am older student and not as likely to be taken in by gloss.  At times felt like I was sitting in some sort of infomerical for a feel good world.  A good storyteller, but very into himself.  Please don't ask us to put your name up for a teaching award, blech!!!
